intro: Arrabidaea belizensis, commonly known as the Belize beauty or the red spider lily, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking red flowers with a white center. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. It has strap-like leaves and produces clusters of showy, spider-like blooms. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
